titleStmt.title: An elegy, in memory of that famous, learned, reverend and religious Doctor Oldsworth late chaplain to the ever living Majesty of Charles the Martyr, and sometime vice-chancellour to the now dying University of Cambridge, a principall sufferer in stormy-beaten Sion, but a stout maintainer of the purity of the Protestant profession.
titleStmt.author: W. F.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Amongst th' traine of Friends (good Sir) I bring".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
